content:
• Friday, March 17, 2017

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: ARLZ-OLD +5.3%. SFM +4.5%. DEST +3.8%. EXK +3.5%. MVIS +3.4%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: PULM -15.9%. ABBV -3.9%. VRAY -3.2%. ASBB -3.0%. RIC -2.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:48 PM | 23 Comments
  • DGSE

    DGSE Companies expects Q1 profit; Shares +5.92% AH

    • DGSE (NYSEMKT:DGSE) expects to post a profit in the Q1 for the first time in four years.
    • The updated expectations was due to extraordinary gains in its retail business. The company also anticipates this turnaround to continue guiding the company toward higher revenues and regained profitability.
    • Shares +5.92% AH
     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM

  • Weekly ETF Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: KOL +5.6%. EWY +5.0%. URA +4.9%. GDXJ +4.6%. DEM +4.4%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: VXX -7.1%. UNG -3.1%. XLF -1.4%. XLV -1.1%. UUP -1.0%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM
  • ADBE

    Wunderlich Securities upgrades Adobe Systems to Buy

    • From Hold post-Q1 2017 reporting, analyst Ryan MacDonald cites Adobe Systems' (NASDAQ:ADBE) ongoing high-level execution, sound market share and "unmatched" mix of revenue expansion and profitability, factors considered warranting premium valuation.
    • Elevates price target from $115 to $145 (among several $140+ target raises and buy-equivalent reiterations issued subsequent the report). Shares $127.69, +4.36%.
    • Yesterday (March 16, 2017): Adobe Systems +4.2%; Q1 2017, forecasts positive
     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM
  • SND

    Smart Sand extends post-earnings gain, now +16% in two days

    • Fracking sand provider Smart Sand (SND +9.6%) is 16% higher in two days after beating Q4 earnings expectations and reversing a year-ago net loss.
    • SND says Q4 sales of Northern White raw frac sand jumped 19% Q/Q and 156% Y/Y to 274K tons sold vs. 229.7K tons during Q3 and 107.2K tons during Q4 2015, while revenues rose 94% Y/Y to $29.5M, essentially in-line with analyst consensus; SND estimates 2017 capex of ~$55M.
    • Analysts at Johnson Rice today upgraded their investment call for SND to Buy from Accumulate and raised their stock price target by $1 to $21.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 pm

    • Gainers: MVIS +13%. NH +13%. SITO +13%. AVID +10%. SCON +10%.
    • Losers: QBAK -17%. AXTI -16%. EXA -12%. OTC:VLTC -12%. SUNW -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM | 6 Comments
  • JBS

    JBS Foods and BRF decline amid bribery probe

    • JBS Foods (JBS) and BRF (OTC:BRFFF) are under investigation in Brazil for taking part of a bribery scheme, according to Bloomberg.
    • Brazilian media reports that the large police operation involves court orders and detention warrants.
    • JBS is down 11% in Sao Paulo trading and BRF is 8% lower.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM
  • PBR

    Brazil oil union says Petrobras divestment still on hold

    • A regional oil workers' union in Brazil says an injunction freezing sales of assets by Petrobras (PBR -2.7%) will continue to block divestiture, despite this week's audit court ruling allowing sales to go ahead.
    • The audit court ruling overturned an injunction that had suspended sales iand would allow PBR to proceed with the sale of a controlling stake in the BR Distribuidora fuel distribution unit, but the Sindipetro-AL/SE union says its injunction obtained in the state of Sergipe remains in effect.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • SHAK

    SunTrust sees +50% upside on Shake Shack

    • Shake Shack (NYSE:SHAK) is up 3.37% after SunTrust Robinson Humphreys calls out upside of over 50% on the restaurant stock.
    • "Tough year-ago compares in 1Q17 make SSS difficult to predict, but we view our flat SSS est. as achievable, and see risk to SSS decreasing sharply as compares ease starting in 2Q17," writes the SunTrust analyst team.
    • SunTrust think Shake Shack will open up 24 units this year vs. SHAK guidance for 22 to 23. The firm takes its price target to $50.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM | 7 Comments

  • Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

    • Gainers: DDC +12%. WLB +11%. MTL +10%. DELT +9%. FF +9%.
    • Losers: OTC:BIOA -19%. SXCP -11%. CDXC -10%. SXC -10%. LXU -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM | 9 Comments
  • FIVN

    Five9 +6.2%; upgraded to Overweight at Pacific Crest Securities

    • From Sector Weight previously, analyst Brent Bracelin forecasts potential tripling of revenue over the next five years, generated by opportunity to disrupt and supplant legacy on-premise competitors Avaya, Genesys and Aspect (grouping maintains approximately 50% market share). Price target $22.
    • Five9 (NASDAQ:FIVN) $17.88.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM | 1 Comment

  • Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM

    • Gainers: FAC +15%.
    • Losers: AFSI -19%. WAC -10%. PN -10%. GLA -10%. HIFS -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • CBI

    CB&I cut to Hold from Buy at Argus

    • CB&I (CBI -1.9%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy at Argus after posting a sharp Q4 earnings miss and amid energy sector weakness.
    • CBI has faced challenges from energy sector weakness over the last two years, and Argus says it is unlikely to see a sudden rebound in revenue or earnings, adding that the company has been divesting assets in recent quarters, taking nine-figure losses along the way and weakening the balance sheet.
    • Shares have slumped 6% YTD, with the weakness reflecting CBI's current business challenges as well as uncertainties related to the legal dispute with Westinghouse Electric, which bought the company’s nuclear construction business in late 2015.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM | 16 Comments
  • VUZI

    Vuzix -10.35%; Q4 2016 off, records $1.1M write-down

    • Q4 2016 results – revenue $0.62M (+14.8% Y/Y, $0.87M below estimates), net loss $6.3M (vs. $3.5M Y/Y)
    • Other developments – Loss on inventory of $1,124,401 registered (vs. $0 Y/Y), attributed to management decision to lower retail pricing of iWear inventory (from $499 to $299). Vuzix further notes it's targeting a shift away from VR-based iWear offerings to focus greater on enterprise market opportunities.
    • Shares (NASDAQ:VUZI) $6.46.
    • Press release / 8-K
    • Yesterday (March 16, 2017): Vuzix -4.2% after hours, notes material weakness ongoing as of December 2016
     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM | 5 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: PULM +38%. EKSO +35%. DFFN +30%. ABUS +18%. AVXS +17%. CLBS +16%. FAC +15%. NH +14%. CGIX +14%. XGTI +13%.
    • Losers: INNL -26%. OTC:BIOA -22%. ESPR -20%. AFSI -19%. QBAK -19%. CRMD -18%. ADAT -16%. MDCO -14%. AXTI -14%. CAL -13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM | 14 Comments
  • EFOI

    Energy Focus picks Port as new CFO

    • Energy Focus (EFOI +8.9%) appoints controller and former interim CFO Michael Port as its new CFO, replacing Bradley White, who is leaving the company to pursue other opportunities.
    • Port has been EFOI's controller since July 2015, and was interim CFO from August to December 2016, after spending five years as a consultant with Resources Global Professionals.
    • White has been CFO only since December; he had been CFO of EngagePoint Inc. since 2015 following financial roles at National Grid USA and Unisys.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM | 1 Comment
  • CELP

    Cypress Energy Partners downgraded to Hold from Buy at Stifel

    • Cypress Energy Partners (CELP +1.9%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy with a $9.50 price target, cut from $14, at Stifel, even after shares had slumped 26% in two days following Q4 results that included lower than expected revenues.
    • Stifel believes a 50% distribution cut is inevitable, as CELP has not been able to make a value accretive acquisition to help drive distributable cash flow in-line with the ~$0.40/quarter distribution.
    • A 50% distribution cut combined with a $9.50 target price would mean an 8%-plus yield, which the firm notes is still a nice annual overall return, and units could enjoy a big pop if the distribution cut does not happen.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM | 1 Comment

  • Dollar gives up most post-election gains

    • This just in from Bloomberg: Headed for one of its worst weeks of the year, the dollar today touched its lowest level since Nov. 11.
    • The big event this week, of course, was the Fed's "dovish rate hike" on Wednesday, at which the centra bank disappointed dollar bulls hoping for indications of a plan for a sped up pace of rate hikes.
    • Morgan Stanley also takes note of lessened political risks in Europe after the status quo prevailed over the nationalists in Dutch elections.
    • ETFs: UUP, UDN, USDU
     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM | 47 Comments

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 12:10 PM

    • Gainers: PULM +40%. DFFN +28%. EKSO +22%. CLBS +19%. AVXS +18%.
    • Losers: CRMD -26%. INNL -24%. ESPR -20%. MDCO -17%. ADPT -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM

  • Consumers - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 PM

    • Gainers: EFOI +8%.
    • Losers: CAL -13%. VRTV -12%. VUZI -9%. BRFS -8%. SNAK -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM
  • VSLR

    Vivint Solar +8% on smaller than expected Q4 loss, upbeat outlook

    • Vivint Solar (VSLR +8.1%) surges higher after Q4 results include a smaller than expected loss for the third straight quarter and a ~160% Y/Y revenue increase.
    • VSLR says it installed 47 MW during Q4, its lowest level since Q1 2015, and forecasts 43-46 MW in installations for Q1 2017, but 57 MW booked during Q4 means its backlog is growing, and the company expects installations to increase during the summer months.
    • VSLR lowered its installed cost per watt during Q4 to $3.08, and expects to bring costs per watt down to $2.95-$3.05 during Q1.
    • For FY 2017, VSLR expects 210-230 MW installations at a cost per watt of $2.82-$2.94.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM | 7 Comments
  • ZSAN

    Zosano Pharma lower after pricing share offering

    • Zosano Pharma (ZSAN -7%) prices its public offering of 17M shares at $1.50 per share.
    • The company expects to generate proceeds of $25.5M before fees are deducted.
    • The offering is expected to close around March 23.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • MULE

    MuleSoft opens 42.6% over initial offer pricing

    • Having yesterday priced at $17, shares in MuleSoft (NYSE:MULE) are to this point in strong debut, trading higher by approximately 50%+ (currently $25.40, open $24.25).
    • The operation, founded in 2006, facilitates the creation of networks connected across data, applications and hardware devices primarily through API-based solutions.
    • Blog post [MuleSoft]
     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM | 1 Comment
  • STML

    Stemline -4.5% after results, another patient death

    • In its 10-K filed alongside Q4 earnings this morning, Stemline Therapeutics (NASDAQ:STML) disclosed another patient death in the Phase 2 trial of SL-401.
    • Shares were down as much as 20% in premarket action, but currently off just 4.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM | 6 Comments
  • CAL

    Caleres slumps after earnings

    • Caleres (CAL -12.3%) trades lower after reporting Q4 results amid what it calls a "promotional and challenging" retail environment.
    • Same-store sales were up 0.3% for the Famous Footwear chain during the quarter to miss the consensus estimate for a 2.3% gain.
    • Shares of Caleres are at their lowest level since November.
    • Previously: Caleres misses by $0.05, beats on revenue (March 16)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM
  • SNAP

    Mizuho Securities initiates Snap at Neutral

    • Amid the gradual retracing of Snap (SNAP -2.4%) shares in the direction of its initial $17 offering price (currently $19.42), analyst Neil Doshi, setting $20 target, notes execution on user growth and engagement is necessary to warrant present valuation while competition for both users and advertising dollars escalates.
    • Notes EV/DAU of roughly $134 at the $17 offering price is approximately 2.2x greater than Facebook's cost for WhatsApp and 4.5x that of the price it paid for Instagram, properties with, at those points, materially more rapid growth than Snap.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM | 16 Comments
  • TXRH

    Upside seen for Texas Roadhouse

    • BTIG Research upgrades Texas Roadhouse (TXRH +3.5%) to Buy from Neutral.
    • The firm lifts its price target to $50, repping 17% upside potential.
    • BTIG on TXRH: "We believe heavy promotional activity drowned out Texas Roadhouse’s consistent value proposition and that as this activity subsides, same-store sales should improve throughout the year. We believe that at current levels, expectations have been appropriately reset and the combination of consistent unit growth and a potential sales acceleration lead to our more positive view."
    • Shares of Texas Roadhouse have been in a gentle uptrend since bottoming out at $37.23 in late February.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM
  • AMGN

    Amgen -6%, MDCO -22%, ESPR -30% after Repatha data

    • The data from the $1B+ study of Repatha look good - heart risks cut by 15% on the primary endpoint, and a 20% reduction in the key secondary endpoint of reduction or risk of first heart attack, stroke, or cardiovascular death.
    • Investors, however, were hoping for an upside surprise of something more than 20%.
    • Then there's costs - north of $14K per year. Insurers are naturally reluctant to pay for the drug without evidence is protects high-risk patients from heart attacks and strokes.
    • Amgen (AMGN -6%), Esperion (ESPR -29.5%), The Medicines Company (MDCO -22.1%), Alnylam Pharma (ALNY -6%)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:37 AM | 63 Comments
  • SEAS

    SeaWorld Entertainment slides off of Citi gloom

    • Citi cuts SeaWorld Entertainment (SEAS -4%) to a Sell rating on concerns that Street EBITDA estimates may be too high.
    • The firm expects 2017 EBITDA of $339M for the theme park operator vs. $357M consensus.
    • The price target from Citi on SEAS goes to $15 from $19.
    • SeaWorld has flirted with the $20 level several times, but hasn't closed over the threshold since last April.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:37 AM
  • NFLX

    Netflix shys away from all-time high, what next?

    • Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) is down 1.03% in premarket action as shares back away from the all-time of $146.50 printed yesterday.
    • M Science is out with a cautious take on Q1 subscriber data, according to Bloomberg. The firm holds some weight with Netflix sentiment due to its data-heavy analysis of consumer trends.
    • Shares of Netflix are up 17% YTD and have jumped 48% over the last 52 weeks.
    • More: There's a pretty good debate on the upside potential for Netflix from here in the comment stream of an article posted last week from SA contributor Celeritas Investments.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:21 AM | 8 Comments

  • Premarket Losers as of 9:05 am

    • CRMD -24% on FY earnings.
    • MDCO -22% on Trump's 20% budget cut for National Institutes of Health.
    • STML -19% on Q4 earnings.
    • ESPR -16% on Trump's 20% budget cut for National Institutes of Health.
    • INNL -15% on Q4 earnings.
    • VRTV -9% continuing its two-day losing streak on Q4 earnings.
    • VUZI -8% on Q4 earnings.
    • EDIT -7% on lower price of secondary offering.
    • AMGN -6% on Trump's 20% budget cut for National Institutes of Health.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM | 23 Comments
  • CRMD

    CorMedix crushed after warning on cash

    • CorMedix (NYSEMKT:CRMD) plunges after some frank talk from the company on its ability to fund itself.
    • "Our commercial operations have not generated sufficient revenues to enable profitability."
    • "We will need additional funding to complete the hemodialysis clinical trial in the U.S. which commenced in December 2015 as well as to initiate the planned Phase 3 clinical trial in oncology patients with catheters."
    • The company is seeking a funding partner, but warns it may have to scale back operations.
    • SEC Form 10-K
    • Previously: CorMedix beats by $0.06, beats on revenue (March 17)
    • CRMD -23.67% premarket to $1.58.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM | 1 Comment

  • Premarket Gainers as of 9:05 am

    • CLBS +53% on sale of 80.1% stake in its PCT subsidiary.
    • ABUS +14% on licensing deal with Alexion.
    • VIVE +6% on capital raise.
    • ADBE +5% on Q4 earnings.
    • ESEA +5% on improving shipping rates.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:09 AM | 2 Comments
  • AVXS

    AveXis soars after positive Phase 1 trial results

    • AveXis (NASDAQ:AVXS) pops after positive results from a Phase 1 trial of AVXS-101 in spinal muscular atrophy Type 1.
    • The company says no new treatment-related safety or tolerability findings resulted from the trial.
    • AveXis also reported Q4 results yesterday, which included a cash position of $240M at the end of 2016. A net loss of $25.4M was reported for the quarter.
    • Previously: AveXis misses by $0.12 (March 16)
    • Source: Press Release
    • AVXS +11.29% premarket to $81.00.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:53 AM | 14 Comments
  • GIMO

    Gigamon +3.35%; upgraded to Outperform at JMP Securities

    • From Market Perform, analyst Erik Suppiger cites channel discourse indicating ongoing strength in competitive positioning and in demand for network visibility, while also highlighting record Q4 2016 customer additions with the view greater expansion and diversification remain opportunities.
    • Price target $45. Gigamon (NYSE:GIMO) $37.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:50 AM
  • ABUS

    Arbutus Biopharma and Alexion in new licensing deal

    • Arbutus Biopharma (NASDAQ:ABUS) jumps 8.4% in premarket trading after the company licenses lipid nanoparticle technology to Alexion Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ALXN).
    • Deal terms: "Alexion will pay Arbutus $7.5 million upfront, and payments of up to $75 million for achievement of development, regulatory, and commercial milestones, as well as single digit royalties. In addition, Arbutus will conduct technology development and provide manufacturing and regulatory support for the rapid advancement of Alexion's mRNA product candidate."
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 8:44 AM
  • VIVE

    Viveve Medical +3% after upsizing capital raise

    • The company sold 7.5M shares at $4 each. The underwriters have a greenshoe option to buy another 1.125M shares at that price.
    • VIVE +3.05% to $4.38 premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:39 AM
  • AXTI

    AXT -3% pre-market; B. Riley & Co. downgrades to Neutral

    • Firm (analyst Dave Kang) recalculates from Buy following AXT's (NASDAQ:AXTI) disclosure a fire at the company's Beijing plant will likely cause Q1 2017 revenue to register $1.5M-$2M below what had previously been forecasted (revised to $18M-$18.5M from $19.5M-$20M). Notes consideration for possible setback of 3D sensing opportunity.
    • Price target from $8.25 to $7 (pre-market $6.40).
    • Yesterday (March 16, 2017): AXT -15.2%, fire at Beijing facility impacts manufacturing production
     
     
     
     
    | 8:33 AM | 3 Comments
  • STLD

    Steel Dynamics sees Q1 earnings above consensus; +4% premarket

    • Steel Dynamics (NASDAQ:STLD) +4.3% premarket after issuing above consensus guidance for Q1 earnings, seeing EPS of of $0.77-$0.81 vs. analyst expectations for $0.62.
    • STLD expects Q1 profitability from steel operations to meaningfully increase from Q4, based on both higher shipments and metal spread expansion, with higher earnings driven by its flat roll operations, as demand remains strong and customer inventory levels continue to be positioned at historically low levels.
    • STLD also declares a quarterly cash dividend of $0.155/share, an 11% increase over the 2016 quarterly rate.
    • Yesterday, Nucor also issued a strong Q1 earnings outlook.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:23 AM | 3 Comments
  • CLBS

    Caladrius Biosciences up nearly 50% after asset sale

    • Alongside a Q4 earnings beat, the company last night announced the sale of its remaining 80.1% stake in its PCT subsidiary to Hitachi Chemical (which owns the other 19.9%) for $75M in cash. A revenue milestone could allow for another $5M payment.
    • Closing is expected in May.
    • Proceeds will be used to fund the Phase 2 trial for CLBS03, and the pay off the company's remaining $5.5M in outstanding debt.
    • A conference call is set for 8:30 ET.
    • CLBS +46% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:23 AM | 1 Comment
  • AFSI

    AmTrust needs more time for filing; shares -2.8% pre

    • Additional time is required for the company and its auditor to complete their work. The 10-K will be filed as soon as is practicable.
    • The delay and restatement for 2014 and 2015 largely relate to the timing of recognition of revenue in AmTrust's (NASDAQ:AFSI) service and fee business, which is still expected to remain profitable in those years and 2016.
    • KBW bull Meyer Shields suspends his rating, price target, and earnings estimates until the restated results.
    • Shares -2.8% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:16 AM | 9 Comments
  • TIF

    Solid results from Tiffany

    • Tiffany (NYSE:TIF) reports better comparables sales in Europe, Asia Pacific and the Americas than expected for Q4. Total revenue was up 2% on a constant-currency basis.
    • Gross margin improved 110 bps to 64.1% of sales during the quarter as favorable product input costs factored in.
    • SG&A expenses were 6% higher in Q4 and were 41.5% of sales vs. 38.5% last year.
    • The company paid in effective tax rate of 36.0% vs. 34.4% a year ago.
    • Tiffaney ended the quarter with a merchandise inventory position down 3% Y/Y.
    • Looking ahead, Tiffany sees sales increasing at a low single-digit rate and EPS increasing by a high-single-digit pace vs. +3% consensus. Net cash of $700M and free cash flow of $450M are also expected.
    • Previously: Tiffany beats by $0.07, beats on revenue (March 17)
    • TIF +2.52% premarket to $92.25.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:34 AM
  • MTEM

    Threshold Pharma +64% on merger deal

    • Threshold Pharmaceuticals (THLD) and privately held Molecular Templates agree to merge in an all-stock deal.
    • Alongside, venture capital player Longitude Capital will invest $20M at the close of the merger, assuming other equity commitments of $20M.
    • Molecular Templates’ lead product candidate, MT-3724, is an ETB that targets the CD20 cell surface antigen present in a variety of lymphomas and leukemias. A Phase 1 trial with the drug demonstrated good safety and efficacy in elderly, heavily pre-treated patients.
    • A conference call is set for 8:30 ET.
    • THLD +64% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 7:27 AM | 4 Comments
  • EDIT

    Editas Medicine prices $90M offering

    • Editas Medicine (NASDAQ:EDIT) announces that its offering of 4M shares priced at $22.50 per share.
    • The proceeds from this offering are expected to be ~$90M.
    • Editas Medicine grants the underwriters a 30-day option to purchase up to an additional 600K shares of common stock on the same terms and conditions.
    • The company says it intends to use the proceeds of the offering to fund preclinical studies and clinical trials for its LCA10 program and its other programs to treat genetic and infectious diseases of the eye, preclinical studies of its programs to treat non-malignant hematologic diseases, preclinical studies in its collaboration with Juno Therapeutics, preclinical studies of other research programs, continued expansion of its platform technology and for working capital.
    • The offering is expected to close on March 22.
    • EDIT -2.85% premarket to $24.20.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 7:22 AM | 3 Comments
  • SLS

    Galena Pharma +30% after presentation of positive data for GALE-301 (E39)

    • "This final data from our early stage clinical trial demonstrates that GALE-301 is well tolerated and we were able to obtain statistically significant disease free survival in a small number of patients treated with the optimal dose,” says Chief Medical Officer Bijan Nejadnik.
    • Full details here
    • GALE +30.65% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 7:18 AM | 17 Comments
  • TIF

    Tiffany beats by $0.07, beats on revenue

    • Tiffany (NYSE:TIF): Q4 EPS of $1.45 beats by $0.07.
    • Revenue of $1.23B (+1.7% Y/Y) beats by $10M.
    • Shares +1.6% PM.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 6:43 AM
